title: Connected car leader Zubie names insurance industry veteran to head business development
text:
Zubie
Craig Lozofsky joins in key role as Zubie growth continues in vertical sectors including insurance, automotive, and enterprise fleet
CHARLESTON, S.C. , Sept. 14, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Zubie , a leading connected car provider to insurance companies, automotive and fleet businesses, and consumers, today announced the addition of seasoned insurance and telematics leader Craig Lozofsky as vice president, business development. Lozofsky brings a strong track record of leadership and know-how in the online insurance and connected car sectors to further Zubie's growth in multiple vertical markets.
Zubie provides customized, proven telematics solutions for industry leaders in the insurance, automotive, fleet and mobile telco sectors. Recently recognized as the Best Insurance Telematics Product 2015 by Telematics Update, the Zubie solution delivers rich data and analytics to help make driving safer, easier and less expensive.
Lozofsky offers industry expertise that complements the existing breadth of product, technology and wireless knowledge of the Zubie team. His charter will be continuing Zubie's growth on a global scale through forming strategic partnerships, customized solutions for enterprise vertical sectors, and leveraging additional domestic and international distribution opportunities.
"Craig is a great addition to our management team," said Zubie CEO Tim Kelly . "His insights and in-depth knowledge of the overall telematics landscape are invaluable as the connected car category expands globally, and Zubie continues to expand its tailored solutions to enterprise customers."
Prior to joining Zubie, Lozofsky served as chief marketing officer for MyDrive Solutions, a company that delivered driving behavior insights based on telematics data for insurers, fleet operators and others. Before that, he spent more than 10 years with Answer Financial, the country's largest online insurance comparison shopping service, which was acquired by Allstate. Lozofsky's marketing leadership was instrumental in helping enhance the company's market position and achieve significant growth.
"Zubie has a strong reputation in the industry for innovation, proven solutions, and robust operational capabilities," Lozofsky said. "I am excited about the opportunity to join this team and put my experience to work in helping the company continue its success globally."
About Zubie
Zubie is a connected car platform and service provider focused on making driving safer, easier and less expensive for business enterprises including automotive, insurance, and mobile/telecom operators, as well as consumers and small businesses. The company was formed in 2012, and is headquartered in Charleston, SC , USA. Zubie recently won the "2015 Best Insurance Telematics Product" award from TU Automotive.
